title: How new species arise in the sea

title_detail.value: How new species arise in the sea

summary: How can a species split into several new species if they still live close to each other and are able to interbreed? Using a group of Caribbean reef fishes as a model system, a team of scientists has found that natural selection can couple the evolution of genes for vision and color pattern.
